duties_responsibilities.duty: Support gender-based violence prevention education programming and implement presentations throughout the academic year.
Provide infrastructural support for prevention, education, and outreach workshops for the CARE program and other defined prevention programs.
Communicate effectively orally and in writing with individuals and groups, including in stressful situations.
Address cultural, ethnic, and individual diversity and potentially vulnerable special needs populations with sensitivity and knowledge.
Work effectively in an interdisciplinary environment, including under conditions of high stress and rapidly changing situations.
Ability to work independently at an off-site location during evening hours.

education_certification.credential: Master's degree in Student Affairs, Counseling, Public Health, Social Welfare, or related field.
